text: here in Bhutan a kingdom at the edge of
the Himalayas personal fulfillment isn't
just a spiritual pursuit it's government
policy what I'm doing will create the
conditions that will enable our people
to find happiness it sounds a rather
immodest for me to say this but an
artificial in the way but that is what I
what I believe
instead of gross national product this
mountain kingdom has its own measure of
development what it calls the gross
national happiness FIBA a rice farmer
who uses only one name explains his
concept of happiness as long as my body
is able I keep doing this and my mind is
free I do it for as long as I can and
then when it's time to stop I stop in
that sense I feel like I'm happy
happiness is the complete well-being
body and mental well-being and being
content with what is and with what one
has it's a good mix I think on the
personal level is about family and
friends and having a good time to spend
with them and at a professional level is
finding work that you you know gives you
your life some meaning they feel you
know it's worthwhile doing I think if
you can have these two you find the
right one I think you have a good recipe
for leading a happy life
you
